Boston Value Investing Group

We will meet at MIT in Building 9, Room 255. See the interactive campus map here.

We learn from Warren Buffett and Benjamin Graham. We use publicly available financial reports.

The meeting format is as follows:
Bernie Sandford of C. Silk & Sons presents his experiences as a value investor:
  • How to measure inflation
  • How to learn from Warren Buffet’s bet against the U.S. dollar
  • How to learn from Warren Buffet’s views of “beta” and “volatility”
  • Ben Graham on the origins of stock market prices
  • Is the stock market efficient?
  • Portfolio managers who are compensated to actively manage your funds when in reality they are managing indexes
  • How to benefit from relatively illiquid stocks
  • What should I do with my money now (as of early 2009)?



Bernie Sandford joined C. Silk & Sons in March of 2005. Previously, he worked at Eaton Vance Managed Investments. His focus there was in the Separately Managed Account Group working with some of the top financial consultants to high net worth individuals around the U.S. He gained valuable experience in Tax Managed Investing, specifically helping Ultra High Net Worth clients diversify out of concentrated positions of highly appreciated equity investments. Prior to this, he served as an Internal Wholesaler at Eaton Vance Distributors working with Mutual Funds. A private investor since the age of 18, Bernie realized the way to create wealth was long-term ownership in good businesses through long-term investing. He holds a B.A. in History from Norwich University.

Feel free to contact the leaders Raimondas ( raimondas@hotmail.com ) or Austin ( axs888@yahoo.com) with questions.

We recommend that you read Security Analysis (1934 edition) by Benjamin Graham. We will discuss this book in a future meeting.
